name: rebore
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make a new or wider hole in something, especially in a cylinder in an engine (= the tube-shaped device inside which the part that causes the fuel to produce power moves up and down): The engine can be re-bored without taking it out of the vehicle.
More examplesFewer examplesThe Prime Minister will announce a ban on airguns that can be rebored to fire bullets.The fellow who rebored my bike engine seemed quite experienced.Is it possible to re-bore the 2.6 litre engine to accept 3.0 litre pistons?

[ S ] the act of making a new or wider hole in something, especially in a cylinder in an engine (= the tube-shaped device inside which the part that causes the fuel to produce power moves up and down): When the engine was disassembled, it was found to need a rebore. The gearbox was repaired and given a bearing change, including a re-bore.
[ C ] a gun that could not previously fire real bullets that has been changed so that it can : The weapon is advertised as a rebore, an imitation gun that has been adapted to fire.
